text: Ferguson is a city in St. Louis County, Missouri, United States. The population was 21,203 at the 2010 census. At the 2020 census, the population was 18,527. It is a suburb of St. Louis. ==History== The city of Ferguson was founded in 1855. The city's first schoolhouse was built in 1878. Ferguson was incorporated as a city in 1894. In August 2014, there were riots and protests after a officer, Darren Wilson, shot and killed 18-year-old, Michael Brown. ==References== ==Other websites== * City of Ferguson, official website Category:Cities in Missouri Category:1894 establishments in the United States Category:1890s establishments in Missouri
